info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 4:46PM CDT until July 14 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Tom Green County in west central Texas... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 446 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northeast of Christoval, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Tom Green County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
